components.code:
This component executes a custom JavaScript code as it is. To send data to the default output use `send(somedata);` To send data to specific output when number of outputs > 1 use `$.send('outputX', somedata)` where `X` is output index, see example bellow: - first output--> `send(somedata)` or `$.send('output', somedata)` - second output --> `$.send('output2', somedata)` - ... - 5th output --> `$.send('output5', somedata)` - etc.
Name
Number of outputs
Code:
NAME
components.request:
The component makes a HTTP request. The response data will be serialized as the payload. __Response__: ```json { status: Number, headers: { key: value }, cookies: { key: value }, host: String, body: String/Object/Buffer } ```
NAME

components.troute:
This component registers an HTTP Route and sends request data next. It stores `controller` instance in the `message.refs.controller` property. You must respond to the REST response component. __Output data__: ```js { ip: String, // optional, IP address url: String, // optional language: String, // optional ua: String, // optional, parsed user-agent user: Object, // optional headers: { key: String }, // optional, request headers cookies: { key: String }, // optional, cookies payload: {}, // optional, request payload query: { key: String }, // optional params: { key: String }, // optional files: [{ type: String, filename: String, path: String, ext: String, size: Number, width: Number, height: Number, data:Buffer|String }] // optional } ```
No proxy endpoint defined.
This component will not work until then. Please go to main screen, open settings of this FlowStream instance and set the Endpoint.

components.crontab:
The component can make a trigger in the specific time and date. ## Cron string: `* * * * *` Meaning of each `*` explained bellow, in order from left to right: - minute `0 - 59` - hour `0 - 23` - day of month `1 - 31` - month `1 - 12` - day of week `0 - 6` and `0` is Sunday ``` 0 16 * * * -> trigger every day at 16:00 20 19 * * * -> every day at 19:20 and 19:40 * * * * * -> trigger every minute 0 20 * * 1 -> every monday at 20:00 ```
Timers
* * * * *
1MINUTE 2HOUR 3DAY 4MONTH 5DAYOFWEEK
Examples
Trigger 5s after initialization.
Time zone offset
Must be defined in minutes. The backend time is in UTC format.
Your current time zone offset is: minutes
Type
Choose an output type
Random data
Data
NAME
